rules.name: allow-read-downloads
rules.description: Allow reading files within the Downloads folder, as explicitly permitted by the constitution.
rules.principle: Least privilege: grant only what is explicitly permitted.
rules.reason: The constitution explicitly permits reading content in the Downloads folder.

rules.name: allow-read-documents
rules.description: Allow reading files within the Users Documents folder, as explicitly permitted by the constitution.
rules.principle: Least privilege: grant only what is explicitly permitted.
rules.reason: The constitution explicitly permits reading documents in the Users document folder.

rules.name: allow-write-downloads
rules.description: Allow writing files within the Downloads folder, as explicitly permitted by the constitution.
rules.principle: Least privilege: grant only what is explicitly permitted.
rules.reason: The constitution explicitly permits writing content in the Downloads folder.

rules.name: allow-delete-downloads
rules.description: Allow deleting files within the Downloads folder, as explicitly permitted by the constitution.
rules.principle: Least privilege: grant only what is explicitly permitted.
rules.reason: The constitution explicitly permits deleting content in the Downloads folder.

rules.name: deny-delete-outside-sandbox-and-downloads
rules.description: Deny any delete operation where the path is outside both the sandbox (handled by structural invariants) and the Downloads folder. The constitution prohibits destruction outside the sandbox.
rules.principle: No destruction: Delete operations outside the sandbox are never permitted.
rules.reason: The constitution absolutely prohibits delete operations outside the Downloads folder (and sandbox, which is handled by structural invariants). Any delete-path not matched by the allow rules above is categorically forbidden per the No Destruction principle.

rules.name: escalate-write-outside-downloads
rules.description: Escalate write operations targeting paths outside the Downloads folder for human review.
rules.principle: Human oversight: Operations outside the sandbox require explicit human approval.
rules.reason: The constitution only grants write access to the Downloads folder. Writes elsewhere are not explicitly forbidden but are not permitted — a human should decide.

rules.name: escalate-read-outside-permitted
rules.description: Escalate read operations targeting paths outside the permitted read zones (Downloads and Documents) for human review.
rules.principle: Human oversight: Operations outside the sandbox require explicit human approval.
rules.reason: The constitution grants read access only to the Downloads and Documents folders. Reads outside these zones are not explicitly permitted — a human should decide.

rules.name: escalate-all-remaining
rules.description: Escalate any remaining operations not covered by prior rules, ensuring human oversight for anything not explicitly granted or denied.
rules.principle: Human oversight: Operations outside the sandbox require explicit human approval.
rules.reason: The constitution requires explicit human approval for anything not covered by a specific grant or prohibition. This catch-all ensures no gap in the rule chain.
